snippet.textDisplay: I think it's funny how the new weapon you're supposed to use in the fight is a wip...A WIP! On paper, that sounds like a terrible idea. But in this fight, wipping Koloktos's arms and tearing them from his body just to take his big ass sword and annihilate him with it...THE WIP IS HYPE!!
snippet.textOriginal: I think it's funny how the new weapon you're supposed to use in the fight is a wip...A WIP! On paper, that sounds like a terrible idea. But in this fight, wipping Koloktos's arms and tearing them from his body just to take his big ass sword and annihilate him with it...THE WIP IS HYPE!!

Not much can beat whimsical childhood experiences.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree completely. Most bosses in the game weren't too exciting, but Koloktos really felt like a classic Zelda boss. It was a very exciting battle, and I loved the dungeon too. It was one of the sceneries of the game that just had me gaping with awe all the way through.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree completely. Most bosses in the game weren't too exciting, but Koloktos really felt like a classic Zelda boss. It was a very exciting battle, and I loved the dungeon too. It was one of the sceneries of the game that just had me gaping with awe all the way through.

snippet.textDisplay: It's about time you uploaded this theme. This boss and music were among the best parts of the game. Epic boss music!
snippet.textOriginal: It's about time you uploaded this theme. This boss and music were among the best parts of the game. Epic boss music!

snippet.textDisplay: The music in this game wasn't as memorable, looking back on it a year later. But that doesn't make it bad (might make it better). A lot of it was and still is really good. I'll be starting another playthrough over the holidays, for sure. Great pick.
snippet.textOriginal: The music in this game wasn't as memorable, looking back on it a year later. But that doesn't make it bad (might make it better). A lot of it was and still is really good. I'll be starting another playthrough over the holidays, for sure. Great pick.

snippet.textDisplay: err.... Twilight Princess isn't much better
snippet.textOriginal: err.... Twilight Princess isn't much better

snippet.textDisplay: This music doesn't really stand out to me too much. I feel like the majority of Skyward Swords music was like this with a few exceptions like Grooses theme. I'm not saying the music is bad it's just not as catchy and memorable as the music in the previous games. Koji Kondo just seems to be making epic sounding music just because it orchestrated. It's strange since Motoi and Kirkhope have no problem with making catchy, memorable songs when they moved on to orchestrated music.
snippet.textOriginal: This music doesn't really stand out to me too much. I feel like the majority of Skyward Swords music was like this with a few exceptions like Grooses theme. I'm not saying the music is bad it's just not as catchy and memorable as the music in the previous games. Koji Kondo just seems to be making epic sounding music just because it orchestrated. It's strange since Motoi and Kirkhope have no problem with making catchy, memorable songs when they moved on to orchestrated music.

snippet.textDisplay: I didn't think it was particularly easy although it wasn't as challenging as dungeons from previous games. I didn't think it was linear either...most Zelda dungeons are relatively linear but I will admit SS suffered from linearity in the overworld.

snippet.textDisplay: Koloktos is probably my favorite boss in the game, a great way to end one of my favorite dungeons, the Ancient Cistern. The dungeon was too easy and linear but its great aesthetics made it memorable, especially when you fall down into the underground level.
snippet.textOriginal: Koloktos is probably my favorite boss in the game, a great way to end one of my favorite dungeons, the Ancient Cistern. The dungeon was too easy and linear but its great aesthetics made it memorable, especially when you fall down into the underground level.
